docs.lead_paragraph: Jeb Bush says he misjudged the intensity of anger among Republican voters before his White House campaign and believes the country in 2016 is "dramatically different" than in past elections. Yet he insists he's still a viable candidate, and one who has broadened his mission to include defending conservativism from GOP front-runner Donald Trump.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mosquito-borne virus has been linked to brain damage in newborn babies in Brazil and other Latin American and Caribbean nations.

headline.main: C.D.C. May Warn Pregnant Women Against Travel to Countries With Zika Virus
headline.print_headline: Virus in South America May Bring C.D.C. Alert

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is questioning whether to advise women not to travel to Brazil and other Latin American and Caribbean countries affected by mosquito-borne Zika virus, which has been linked to infant brain damage; if carried out, warning would be first time center has recommended against pregnant women traveling to specific region during outbreak.
docs.snippet: The mosquito-borne virus has been linked to brain damage in newborn babies in Brazil and other Latin American and Caribbean nations.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force has declared in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

headline.main: Task Force: Mammograms an Option at 40, Do More Good at 50
headline.print_headline: Task Force: Mammograms an Option at 40, Do More Good at 50

docs.snippet: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force has declared in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mammograms do the most good later in life, a government task force declared Monday in recommending that women get one every other year starting at age 50. It said 40-somethings should make their own choice after weighing the pros and cons.

headline.main: When a Big Baby Isn’t So Big

docs.abstract: Research showed that mothers who believed they were having large babies were nearly five times more likely to ask for a scheduled C-section.
docs.snippet: Research showed that mothers who believed they were having large babies were nearly five times more likely to ask for a scheduled C-section.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new reporting requirement for doctors is providing fodder for races for governor and president this year in a polarized Southern swing state.

headline.main: Law on Ultrasounds Reignites Abortion Battle in North Carolina
headline.print_headline: Law on Ultrasounds Reignites the Abortion Debate in a 2016 Battleground

docs.abstract: North Carolina law requiring doctors who perform abortion after 16th week of pregnancy to submit ultrasound to state officials has inflamed public controversy; proponents say law prevents illegal abortions after 20 weeks, while critics call provision violation of privacy and effort to intimidate women and doctors; conservative-led push has been used to motivate voters on both ends of political spectrum in Republican-dominated state.
docs.snippet: A new reporting requirement for doctors is providing fodder for races for governor and president this year in a polarized Southern swing state.
